website_summaries.verdict: This sturdy metal rack has a nice powder-coated finish and plenty of hooks for holding many items.
pros: It has a lot of hooks on 3 different levels and lots of space for items of different sizes
The black metal finish goes with a lot of décor
cons: Understand where all the hooks go before you start to put it together

customer_reviews.title: Happy customer
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected. Easy to put together (still can take a little longer than expected if you're a perfectionist like me) no leaning like some other people complained about. Fits perfectly in the slim corner it was aimed for
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Assembly instructions could be more clear, but assembly was easy and it works well.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered ;this for my club, so coats don't get draped over chairs and tables! It's simple but effective. You will want a fairly large, sturdy Phillips screwdriver to get the screws to tap into the holes ... the little one included is not very effective. \ While assembling, they don't tell you which way to put the spacers on the screws -- put the FLAT side toward the center vertical pipe. Otherwise, it was easy to assemble and worked well at the meeting tonight.
customer_reviews.author: J. Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Good Basic Coat Rack for the Price
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my office to hold sweaters and uniform shirts. It works and looks great. Those who said the screws do not hold, did not screw them all the way in. You do have to turn the provided screwdriver with quite a bit of force before the screws bite through the metal base for a strong hold. I'm not very mechanically inclined but was able to put it together by myself in just a few minutes. I don't think anyone could find any better coat rack for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Fab Ms. Elle

customer_reviews.title: Had to use a drill to finish set up.
customer_reviews.text: I am a person that has no issues following directions or putting things together and this thing was a nightmare. The screws didn't fit into the holes at all and they would get stuck. Finally I had to just use a drill and force them. I gave two stars because after my drill and getting it assembled it works, but next time I'd go with something different.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Gives extra hanging space, light weight and sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: We are please with the Coat Rack Tree ( older folks call them a hall tree to hang jackets, sweaters, hats). You do need a tool to put rack together but takes about 5 minutes. It is light weight. It was purchased to hang hair dryer, pj's and robe on for use in bathroom. It is now being used in my mothers bedroom to put next days clothes and robe. It works great when you take knits or perm press item out of dryer. Just grab it and a few hangers and makes doing laundry and putting every thing away easier. It is sturdy enough for grade school children or the elderly to use. It arrived quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Lucinda

customer_reviews.title: priced appropriately
customer_reviews.text: its not the best, but it wasn't priced that way either. A few recommendations for the seller, use black screws for the Black one and white screws for the white one....or at least provide same color caps. They sent silver screws with the black one which really doesn't look as nice as it would with black hardware. Also need to bore out the holes a little more .....some of the screws would not tighten with a screw driver, had to use a drill. It will sever its purpose I think. I will update post if after use I find other issues.
customer_reviews.author: TAMMY CHAMBERS

customer_reviews.title: Work to Assemble, Does the Job
customer_reviews.text: 12 large parts to screw together. Plastic type position washers are inserted in each screw hole. This not hard. All the screws are the same, except for one screw that holes the two poles together. Alignment needed to put it all together is time consuming. The little half screwdriver sent will not do the job because of the torque needed to tighten the screws. The finish product; does it job. It is not real steady but it should not fall over by slightly bumping into it. The price is fair and it will do the job of hanging up jackets.
customer_reviews.author: DavidTop Contributor: Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: I'd like to meet the person who put this together with the included screwdriver, I won't shake their hand because they'd shatter every bone in my hands... I had to get a regular screwdriver to put this together, which is not a problem with the rack itself, I was just lazy. Anyway, assembled the whole thing in like 15 minutes. It's easy and pretty stable. Hang heavy coats on opposite sides and be careful when you take them off, otherwise it is doing exactly what I wanted... getting coats that aren't used as often out of my way
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad coat rack.
customer_reviews.text: It was a bit difficult to put together; instructions could be better written. My biggest complaint concerns the screws. I got the black coat rack ... the screws are silver! Why aren't they black? Saving grace is this was for my bedroom so no one sees it but me. But really ... silver screws for a black coat rack? Shame shame. It does, however, do the job I needed it for. Would I order another one? I don't know. The silver screws kinda spoiled it for me. But ... should black screws be sent to me, well ...
customer_reviews.author: Rae Harris

customer_reviews.title: Works great as the hat rack I bought it for!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for what I wanted. Plenty of room for hanging. It only took about 20 minutes to put together. All the hardware, including extra is there. There are rubber protectors if you are using it on hardwood. It seems very sturdy, but I'm only using it for hats and bags. It doesn't take up much space, which is exactly what I wanted. Nice corner rack to put all my hats on that were taking up coat hooks in my foyer. Inexpensive but not a cheap feel.
customer_reviews.author: J. J. Brockey

customer_reviews.title: Purse & Coat Rack
customer_reviews.text: I bought this coat rack for the sole purpose of using to hold some of my purses / clutches. So far so good. I definitely recommend using your own screwdriver to assemble it. The small one that’s provided with the kit, will not do the trick. You’ll also need some muscle to tighten the screws.
customer_reviews.author: QdotSupreme

customer_reviews.title: Screws do not tighten
customer_reviews.text: So I bought this product to use as a coat hanger for work. A coworker helped me set this up and we soon realized that the screws do not screw all the way in. Any attempts to tighten them (tried both with the tool it came with and an electric screwdriver) doesn't work so all of the hooks are a bit loose and shaky. The stand seems stable enough (it's the only part that would tighten), and so far the hooks are holding my coat, but I don't feel a high sense of trust for this coat rack. Clearly it is cheaply made or the screws would probably fit.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline

customer_reviews.title: Falls down a lot
customer_reviews.text: Building this was interesting, I got everything on but needed a drill to finish tightening the screws, I had to push to hard on it that all the things I had put on but did not tighten yet fell off. If you are not careful of where you hang things it will tip very easily. I use it for my family of 3; myself, boyfriend, and 8 year old and it falls on my son probably once every two weeks. I wish it was more sturdy. You should not have to calculate where to put your coat, especially since my son most certainly will not ever do that.
customer_reviews.author: chelsea c.

customer_reviews.title: I love the way it looks and we've got tons of ...
customer_reviews.text: We've always wanted a coat rack of sorts and our small space doesn't support the whole bench and mirror thing. I love the way it looks and we've got tons of stuff on it. One only needs to be cautious when placing a heavier item on it. It will start to tip if you're not right in front of a leg, but once you've righted it and placed the coat it's balanced fine. This picture doesn't include my husband multi-pocket large air force coat and his helmet, but they go on there fine as well.
customer_reviews.author: Cheri

customer_reviews.title: I regret buying this
customer_reviews.text: So this was supposed to be easy to put together but the screws didn't want to go in all the way and they keep falling out. Now it's just laying on the floor because i don't wanna deal with it right now
customer_reviews.author: Cecilia M. Ybarra

customer_reviews.title: Great coat rack on a budget.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little coat rack for people not wanting to spend a ton of money. I bought it because our main coat closet is in the back side of the house and wanted something close to the front door for guests other than the dining room chair. It arrived quickly, is easy to assemble, and looks nice standing in the front hall. Gave it 4 stars only because it is so light weight that it can tip if weight isn't distributed.
customer_reviews.author: Busy mom

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed and wanted!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a coat rack for a while but my family didn't think we needed it. I had it on my wish list for over a year but no one would buy it. I pulled the trigger and ordered it myself. Instant hit! Everyone loves it and my kids all apologized to me for doubting the coat rack. It's easy to assemble and even came with a screw driver. I didn't see the included one at first and went and grabbed my own... only to realize it wasn't needed.
customer_reviews.author: Spike

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and functional
customer_reviews.text: This is a quality product that is really not that difficult to assemble. It has metal screws that are self tapping. This requires a longer screw driver with a Phillips head of significant size. If you try and put it together with an average size Phillips screwdriver or the enclosed very small device it will be impossible. If the screws aren’t completely inserted the stand will be off center. if you aren't strong enough put pressure on the screws to allow them to self tap, get some help. don't strip them.
customer_reviews.author: D. stark

customer_reviews.title: OK for the Price
customer_reviews.text: A bit of a PITA to put together, the screws are self-tapping and it took quite a bit longer than I thought it would. The screws are bright shiny metal and stand out against the black of the hooks - would have looked better with black screws. Doesn't balance very well, wants to tip over when you "toss" a jacket onto it. But - It keeps the jackets here at the office off of chairs and it does it just fine. If you just need a coat tree and don't care about looks, this is great for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Far Left Texas

customer_reviews.title: works well at the entrance
customer_reviews.text: This was a bit tough to assemble with the enclosed screw driver. So get a Phillips screw driver with large handle. The self tapping screws need to be exactly straight and it requires some torque to put them all the way in. But, nothing stripped out, so that was nice. Once assembled, it works well beside my door to receive and hold coats, caps and hats. Stability and sturdiness are acceptable and it functions well for it's intended purpose.
customer_reviews.author: clvance7

customer_reviews.title: A good product overall
customer_reviews.text: This was delivered as promised, very quickly. The final assembled piece looks nice and works well ... it went into immediate service! The only criticism I have is that assembly wasn’t real easy, despite good instructions. My husband is a strong guy, but he really huffed and puffed to get the screws to tap into the holes that were basically punched (as opposed to being machined to work with the supplied screws). Other than that, he felt it was a pretty high quality piece.
customer_reviews.author: Safari Lori

customer_reviews.title: Great help to de-clutter the house.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great rack, yes you have to put it together and that is a bit of a pain but how else could it be shipped. Putting it together was not so bad. I was able to do it while my 3 kiddos played. The Coat Rack itself is fantastic. We are using ours to hold all of our hats and random bags (shopping bags, beach bags, work bags and kids backpacks) so that our house is not cluttered with all of those items. The amount of items it holds is pretty significant and the rack is able to hold everything with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela

customer_reviews.title: never again
customer_reviews.text: Delivery was on time but did not come with any of the promised screws and washers. After waiting for a week for customer service to resolve, had to buy the screws/washers from hardware store. Tips over quite easily but otherwise okay for the price. Customer service is the worst.
customer_reviews.author: Vampyre

customer_reviews.title: Very chic look
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my daughter who's in college for Christmas and she loved it.. At first she was sceptical saying " I'm not sure mom " . Once set up she loved the chic look to it and by the next day she said thank you mom it helps me so much for when I'm lazy and I dont have were to hang my jacket and hats. Lol
customer_reviews.author: Argenis

customer_reviews.title: Worth my money
customer_reviews.text: Glad i found this. I almost bought the ‘best seller’ but because of the mix reviews, i needed to search more. This rack is really sturdy, easy to assemble and price is good. My husband who assembled this asked me where i bought this because he was impressed by this product. Not too light and not too heavy. Thumbs up!
customer_reviews.author: Grazy

customer_reviews.title: But I’m so glad I ordered it
customer_reviews.text: I was sceptical if this product. But I’m so glad I ordered it. It’s lightweight which has me nervous. But it has held up to holding our winter stuff perfectly. Being in Texas we just have sweaters and such on it but there are sloth on it with 6 people in the house! Assembly was fast and easy, though I’d suggest using a regular Philips head, not the one provided, and it makes it a lot easier.
customer_reviews.author: Christina Smith

customer_reviews.title: Easy Assembly, Sturdy, Looks Great
customer_reviews.text: Was super easy to assemble. Had all the parts and some spares. I bought this because my kids were fighting over where to hang their backpacks. The three bottom hooks were perfect height for my three youngest. We've already hung it with school bags, baseball hats and jackets. Takes up a very small amount of space. Bought the black to match my decor. It looks great, and is very sturdy. What I needed exactly. Completely happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Haws

customer_reviews.title: Unable to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Wasnt able to assemble, i used a screw driver that came with the package and i used my homedepot screw driver but unable to make the stand work. Then i used a power screw driver a the screws and holes were uneven and still wasnt able to assemble it. Disappointed. i didnt have time to write a review now i ordered a lighter wooden clothes rack. unhappy customer.
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: Looks cute, but.. Holy cow.. that was hard to assemble!!
customer_reviews.text: Let me start by saying, we are very capable, handy people. This darn thing was SO HARD TO ASSEMBLE! Okay, it isn't rocket science. But, to get the darn screws into those holes was almost impossible without a power tool. Just a head's up.. do your hand strengthening exercises before attempting this bad boy. Once it was assembled, it looks really nice. I'm happy with it, but will not ever buy another one if this one were to break... just too hard to assemble. Did I mention it's hard to assemble?
customer_reviews.author: Garrett S

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: This coat rack does the job at a good price. It is a bit tedious to assemble, but you get past that. It seems sturdy enough, but we live in a warm climate so our jackets are light weight. If you want to hang a bunch of heavy wool winter coats on it then ... ah, it probably do okay with those too.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Screws would not fit in pre-drilled holes
customer_reviews.text: Perhaps it's just my bad luck, but it seems the majority of the time I purchase a product with pre-drilled holes, there is a problem. This product was no exception. I aligned the pieces and the washer, tried to screw it in, and could only turn the screws twice. Took the pieces off, tried to just put the screw in the hole and it would barely turn three times. This was not enough to secure the legs to the base. Too bad because it looked to be a decent product if I would go together. This is going back.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy A Slater

customer_reviews.title: Very light weight, falls over a lot
customer_reviews.text: This coat hanger looks fine. It was easy to set up and does not cost a lot. But it is really light weight and I think it could use a 4th leg to be more sturdy. Putting a cardigan, or sweater on it is fine. My purse will hang on it as long as it is not too full, but my packpack will make it fall over. I would not buy it again and rather buy a heavier, sturdier one.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: I love the simplicity of it's design - it's nothing fancy
customer_reviews.text: Snagged this on prime day. Whoop Whoop! I love the simplicity of it's design - it's nothing fancy, but it serves it's purpose. I purchased the white one and it's exactly the same color of the photo. It was easy to put together and it requires no tools, as they are provided - however I did use an electric screwdriver and I would recommend that, as it will secure the pieces in better than manually doing so.
customer_reviews.author: Christie J. Ryan

customer_reviews.title: A decent coat rack - easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: Nice rack - fairly easy to put together. It looked a bit like it might fall over if you put a heavy coat on it, but I tested it will the heaviest coat we have and it was fine. If it is bumped with a heavy coat on it and nothing else, it will fall over - but an easy way to solve that is to put another coat or jacket on the opposite side of it. All-in-all, a decent rack with plenty of hooks for those umbrellas, hats, gloves, and scarves in the Winter.
customer_reviews.author: TaterTot Lover

customer_reviews.title: Just don't.
customer_reviews.text: It's okay once it's set up although it's a little wobbly. The main problem is the set-up. It's not hard to figure out how, but you have to be incredibly strong to force the screws into place. Not for seniors or non bodybuilders. Added to review: I have several different kinds of these and this is by far the worst. It falls over constantly and I've had to throw it away. Garbage!
customer_reviews.author: D Richman

customer_reviews.title: Nice, Easy to Assemble, A Little Too Light
customer_reviews.text: This coatrack is nice and met our expectations, but definitely is a little too lightweight for heavy winter jackets. It holds them fine (no structural issues at all, definitely well constructed metal) but if the weight of what's hanging is not balanced exactly it tips quite a bit and you have to catch it to keep it from falling over. I think it'll be more handy in the spring/fall/summer.
customer_reviews.author: C. L.

customer_reviews.title: All good, bargain price BUT a royal pain to assemble
customer_reviews.text: The assembly was a complete nightmare and therefore my 4 stars instead of 5. The screws are very short so it takes a while to get all holes aligned. One of them was impossible to fully screwed but this did not affect the sturdiness nor the stability of the rack.
customer_reviews.author: Lolo

customer_reviews.title: It sucks. Doesn’t hold together. Don’t buy it.
customer_reviews.text: It even hurts me to put just one star. This is the worst coat rack I HAVE EVER SEEN! First of all the when we got it, assembling it took forever! Why? Because I’m pretty sure they sent the wrong parts for it. Nothing fit perfectly, THE HOLE WHERE THE “screws” go WERENT EVEN COMPLETLY PUNCHED OUT! Which made it take longer to put together. I thought that was the worst part about it... BUT I WAS WRONG. It’s starting to fall apart because the “screws” don’t hold BECAUSE THEY DONT FIT THE HOLES PROPERLY!! Over this coat rack, oh and did I mention that ITS NOT EVEN STURDY
customer_reviews.author: Vickie

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied with purchase
customer_reviews.text: I love it now that it is fully assembled. I tried to do it myself, but couldn't get screws into some holes at all and some not completely screwed down, but I do have arthritis in my hands. My 19 yr. old grandson had no problem. I do watch that things hanging on it are balanced, but with just a little thought, it should not be a problem falling over. For the price, I think it works as well as any and better than most. I bought it in white and it had no issues with finish. Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: BamaMama

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble, does its job, light
customer_reviews.text: I use this in my room because I didn't have enough hooks in my closet to put things. It was easy to assemble and it looks as it is pictured/described. Easy to move, even with things on it. Only complaint is that the rack is fairly lightweight which means that it can tip over easily if one side weighs just a little bit more than the other.
customer_reviews.author: R1928

customer_reviews.title: Gets top heavy and falls over. Easy assembly. Solid, and looks nice.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble. Not designed well for heavy coats, as it WILL fall over. The legs aren't spaced enough to keep its balance very well. Otherwise it's handy for light-wear jackets, and you'll be somewhat balancing the scale with heavier stuff. I like it though. Looks nice and stays invisible in a corner.
customer_reviews.author: Porter L.

customer_reviews.title: Looks great and very stable
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived on time and in perfect condition. Assembly was quick and easy. All parts accounted for; and even an extra set of screws (they must know I have carpal tunnel and drop small parts 8-). Coat tree is very stable (even though lighter than previous wood rack damaged by movers) and looks good.
customer_reviews.author: Larry E. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Good quality for the price point!
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised by how well this ended up working. For the price, I expected something that would tip over or look really cheap, but this has held up well and is sturdy! You really need to use an actual screwdriver to install it as the tool provided is useless. Some of the holes weren’t drilled perfectly, but I was able to fix them w/o much trouble.
customer_reviews.author: Lizzibella

customer_reviews.title: Hooks stay loose and dangling; screws don't secure tightly
customer_reviews.text: The hooks don't screw in tightly. You put these plastic washers between the hook and the pole, and they are not even the right shape to fit up to the hook. The screw will only go in so far, so the hooks are loose and dangling. Even the three base feet are loose so you can wiggle them. It will serve its purpose, but it's always going to be wobbly all over.
customer_reviews.author: Marty Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy! Poorly made, cheap product.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve built quite a few of these self assembly products. Most have isssues with screws not lining up perfectly but never this bad. 3 days and I still only have half of it put together the screws get damaged very easily if too much pressure is applied. If no pressure is applied it doesn’t line up or screw in all the way (I can get the screws about half way in before destroying them). Don’t waste your money!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT CUSTOMER SERVICE MAKES EVERYTHING BETTER (REVISED)
customer_reviews.text: This is the most complicated project I have had!! It sounds crazy, considering it's only a stand but the screws don't fit so while trying to get it lined up and connected, the middle rolls, the top slips. Omg what an adventure. I rated 2 stars not because the quality or asthetics but because I have given up before it is even together. Sorry *** Revision **** Seller reached out to me, sent new documents to use for assembly, and we have a beautiful Coat Rack now. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Erika C

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and attractive
customer_reviews.text: I've used this daily for 4 months, including through winter. My husband has SO many coats that our anchored rack with hooks ripped out of our wall. We got this coat rack to supplement the (reattached) hooks. It has NEVER tipped and has plenty of space for his stuff. It's a nice design that isn't intrusive on other decor.
customer_reviews.author: Aleithea Abbott

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: This was incredibly easy to put together, and for reference: I've never put anything together in my life. I was done with assembly in 45 minutes and it's very sturdy. Holds all of my coats and jackets neatly. Very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Value for the money
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful coat rack - amazing value for the money. It is built to last and easy to assemble. It does tip over on occasion but my son tends to heap a lot of hoodies on it, rendering it a little unstable. Amazingly strong for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Shaw

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for hats and scarves
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for hats and scarves! This rack is exactly what I needed for smaller items. The assembly is relatively simple-all you need is a Phillips Head screwdriver. I do think calling it a coat rack is a bit of a misnomer as I think it is more of a jacket rack.The hooks up top would carry the weight of coats, but then they would cover the lower hooks. The lower hooks could carry jackets, but any long coats would drag on the floor. But, if you are looking for a rack to hang scarves and hate-this is a great buy and offers 11 hooks for that purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Eileen

customer_reviews.title: Too lightweight for my needs.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased several for my office. They are made of such lightweight material that could barely hold a trench or winter coat. Wobbly and the predrilled holes didn’t line up. Only opened one of the boxes. Left the rest sealed because why bother. Returned everything.
customer_reviews.author: heather A

customer_reviews.title: To hang my pool towels to dry
customer_reviews.text: I bought it to keep outside and hang pool towels and bathing suits. And works perfectly fine for what i wanted it for. You just have to even the weight of towels to each side so it wont tip over.
customer_reviews.author: L@dydi

customer_reviews.title: the only thing I would say is that I would have liked it a little more sturdy because sometimes I walk ...
customer_reviews.text: It works very well, the only thing I would say is that I would have liked it a little more sturdy because sometimes I walk in the house and just put my jacket on whatever is closes. When I should be putting jackets around to keep the weight off one side or it will fall to the side. But other then that one thing the install was easy and quick and I love it!
customer_reviews.author: JokerDan

customer_reviews.title: Only buy if you own a power drill
customer_reviews.text: This was very difficult to assemble. I’m not sure if the screws I received were the wrong size, but the only way I was able to put this all together was with a drill. Screwing them in by hand was not possible. Once the power drill (not included) was used, it’s turned out pretty sturdy. Just make sure to distribute the coats evenly around the rack. Summary: if you manage to put it together, does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie

customer_reviews.title: Assembles fine.
customer_reviews.text: Everything assembled together just fine. Parts were there, finish is okay. Its thin but durable holding a pretty heavy bullet proof vest so its not bending. Its rather bulky and to me is not to my taste but its in my husbands mancave and he likes it just fine. Great if you have a guy who has a lot of hats and stuff to hang up and I found it on the lightening deals so cost was so much less.
customer_reviews.author: SuZckTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Think Twice.
customer_reviews.text: This is the first time that I leave a negative comment on items I bought, and I'm sorry, but a girl should definitely avoid this, unless you have a full pack of tools and Hulk's arms. Apparently, I had none. Struggled hours trying to tighten the screws and hurt my fingers, only to find the length of the screws NOT suitable at all. Too short at the bottom and too long at top. Gave a passing overall rate because it hasn't fall down, which definitely would one day in the future. Think twice plz.
customer_reviews.author: Asteria

customer_reviews.title: Looks great and easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.text: My husband wanted a coat rack for the garage for his motorcycle jackets. I bought this because it looked sturdy and it is. I assembled it myself so trust me...it's easy. It is solid and looks nice. I wouldn't mind having one for the house.
customer_reviews.author: Maureen Cashin

customer_reviews.title: Stability is an issue
customer_reviews.text: It looks good and we are using it, but its main problem is stability. So we hang our clothes in away that will balance the hanger. Otherwise it falls down unfortunately
customer_reviews.author: Hussain Alaskari

customer_reviews.title: Total Crap. Worst Product, Ever.
customer_reviews.text: With the time it takes to assemble this light as a feather, cheaply made THING... you could have made your own coat stand with recycled materials. In fact, I suggest it. This THING, is crap. Poorly planned, crap. It comes with screws .... to screw into holes... in the lightweight metal? It defies all logic. There is nothing holding this thing together and i sadly bought TWO of them for my new apartment. Don't make my mistake. Go make your own coat rack... shoot- tap a nail into the wall like they did in the good old days. Just don't buy this Thing.
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I have this in my closet to hang clothing items that are not quite ready to be thrown in the wash but cannot be put back with all of the other clothes. The weight distribution is excellent. I've stacked tons of heavy clothes and it's still held up. It's not the most glamorous piece of material but it's functional.
customer_reviews.author: BT093

customer_reviews.title: Looking for a coat rack
customer_reviews.text: We are so happy. We have looked and looked for this kind of coat hanger. We love it. Doesnt take up room. I think we can get 7 coats on it. Thank you for making this kinda coat tree.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda  Riggins Segafredo

customer_reviews.title: Easily Assembled.
customer_reviews.text: Shipped and arrived very quickly. Very easy to assemble, if you have a medium length, number 2, Phillips head screw driver. They do supply a screw driver of sorts with the hardware kit....... sketchy to use............ at best. Overall I'm happy with it........... so far, so good! Have only had it one day, so far, so good.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not As Hard As It Seems
customer_reviews.text: Everyone says it's very difficult to build. However, it really isn't! The screws seem like they won't go in and they need to be aligned just right, but really you just need to give them a good turn and then once they get past the first few turns it will finish easily. So simple. Only took about 20 minutes to assemble. Good for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install with a cordless drill. Works better when you mount to studs. Mine came with extra hardware. There were these extra plastic grommets used to mount the screw covers that weren't exactly obvious how to use. I figured out that you place them on the screw before mounting with the cupped side facing out. Then you can put the screw covers on top of them when the screw is in place. Nice that this package comes with two. I put one by my door for coats and the other has become my hat rack.
customer_reviews.author: Nelly Alfred

customer_reviews.title: It works for me!
customer_reviews.text: As some other reviews said, I had a bit of trouble getting the screws to go in, but after 30 minutes, I now have a very nice clothes stand! I already have it loaded with clothes and it is stable. Some reviews said that it fell over, but I have not experienced that problem. I am very pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Esther

customer_reviews.title: Need more than 2 hands to assemble.
customer_reviews.text: Pain in the butt to assemble. I am rather handy but these screws are impossible to get in straight or get all the way in the hold. Holding the hook, the spacer and the screw all while trying to use why screwdriver is near impossible. Very frustrating. I believe once it is assembled it will be what I wanted...if I survive the assembly!
customer_reviews.author: PJS

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to assemble
customer_reviews.text: The item looks nice enough. And the instructions were technically very easy to understand. But actual assembly is extremely difficult. It is nearly impossible to line the screws and spacers correctly. Out of the 12 screws I’ve attempted so far, I only have one in correctly. And that’s after 30 minutes. When you don’t screw them in straight, it’s way wobbly. So it is not one of those things you can do imperfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Alex J

customer_reviews.title: Hard to screw in. You’ll get a work out
customer_reviews.text: I’m giving it a general 4 star because 3.5 isn’t an option. Assembly itself is easy except for the screws are VERY HARD to screw in to place . By then end of assembling it I was tired and woke up sore. Sturdy ness is is 3 only because I have carpet so it’s a little wobbly if you Don’t spread the weight evenly. I love that it has many hooks and I can hang a lot on there. Design is simple but it does the job. Good price for what I got except those stupid screws
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money on this.
customer_reviews.text: This may be possible with an electric screwdriver, which I do not have so I have not tried. But currently it appears as though the holes on the body of the tree are wayyyy too small for the screws they provided. I have trued multiple times to attatch the legs and other parts manually and it simply does not work. I am not a novice at putting things together. Don't waste your money on this product.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen78

customer_reviews.title: Well, it’s a coat rack and it holds my coats.
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t found any of my coats on the floor after hanging them on this rack. So it does it’s job well.
customer_reviews.author: Bobbie

customer_reviews.title: It stands.
customer_reviews.text: I like this item. It was easy to assemble. I use it in my office---doesn't take up much space and is attractive. It is a tad flimsy, but I don't expect much for the price. I has held together quite nicely, It works as billed. I would buy another.
customer_reviews.author: C Jones

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy. I have a wooden one I had to ...
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy. I have a wooden one I had to throw out because it kept falling over. This one is really sturdy, its covered with purses, sweaters, belts, etc and has yet to teeter. Took me about 15 minutes to put together. It comes with everything you need (no tools needed).
customer_reviews.author: JJW

customer_reviews.title: it does the job and looks nice but I was expecting a little bit better quality
customer_reviews.text: We needed a coat rack for our office that was small and compact. Decided to purchase this one, it does the job and looks nice but I was expecting a little bit better quality. It seems to be very wobbly, however for the price it was still a good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Veronica HTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: IT DOESN’T FLOAT
customer_reviews.text: Very nice 👍. This rack was nicely finished black, no scratches or blemishes. It can’t be used to pry something open, it won’t hit a baseball very far, it doesn’t float, I wouldn’t use it to hold up your garage door, but as an inexpensive coat-hat-purse-umbrella-walking stick rack ... it’s great.
customer_reviews.author: Yeah, .... right

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase
customer_reviews.text: With a home with limited closet space, I must say I appreciate this coat rack. I’m able to place it at the front door. I like the fact that you can adjust the feet on the rack. My only issue is I had a little problem putting it together. The pieces need to be labeled a little better(At least label the bags that each part is in). I figured it out and I’m happy.
customer_reviews.author: A. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Is exactly as pictured. easy to assemble. Holds up well, even with many heavy coats and bags. Will not topple over unless you push it. Pretty sturdy. Glad I bought it. Update 5/17/18: like it so much had to buy another one to use in separate room. Perfect for organizing any hanging items in one place.
customer_reviews.author: Mel Rio

customer_reviews.title: Well manufactured, all parts included properly.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. Good design. All parts were included (including spares) correctly. The directions were not too long and rather concise. The images for the directions were a bit difficult to observe clearly. However, the narrative was easy enough to follow. Screws and holes lined up easily without any major effort to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Y

customer_reviews.title: A bit unstable.
customer_reviews.text: This coat rack is a bit unsteady. You have to make sure you don't put a coat on the wrong branch or it will topple over. When we have guests over and have them hang their coats up we have to be careful which side they go on in order to keep it from crashing down. I wish it was more stable overall. For our daily use however, its fine as long as its balanced.
customer_reviews.author: Ruan Jing

customer_reviews.title: Use tools
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommend not assembling by hand, it’s 100x more stable using a drill. It has survived many attacks from a toddler and cattle dog
customer_reviews.author: Hope F.

customer_reviews.title: Great product , defective part
customer_reviews.text: I just got this product , assembling it was straight forward and easy with a simple instruction they provided . However , the last piece I was about to assemble was defective . I can’t bother to dissemble and return. So I am gonna have to keep it. But I am not completely satisfied with this arrangement . But overall product turned out as expected , only if they sent all the parts in good condition .
customer_reviews.author: Mta

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my office got tired of everyone hanging coats on the back of chairs....and in Calif. we have a bag law you have to provide your own bags or buy the stores reusable bags so its perfect to hang on the coat rack on the bottom so I don't forget them.Bottom line I love it
customer_reviews.author: L BAKER

customer_reviews.title: Mismatched Parts
customer_reviews.text: i just put this together last night. It’s easy to assemble however it’s built very awkwardly. There’re only 3 legs instead of 4 so it’s not very stable when standing. The very top of this rack has 4 hooks but in the stand there are only 3 areas to assemble. It feels like I got an extra top hook instead of a fourth base leg. It also is very cheap product so if you put the screw on a little too tight, the screw wil bend the metal and go through it. Pretty disappointed with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Sudha Shrestha

customer_reviews.title: Decent, you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: Got a new office with no facility to hang anything. I put my motorcycle gear on it (kinda heavy) and it's sturdy enough. The chrome screws on the black body are a bit cheesy, and the screws themselves are of expected low quality. But it does the job. I wouldn't use it as a focal piece in my home, but for my use it's fine.
customer_reviews.author: M. Neubauer

customer_reviews.title: The assembly is actually pretty simple, just make sure you have an electric ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a marvel of interchangeable parts. The assembly is actually pretty simple, just make sure you have an electric screwdriver handy, you'll need to apply more torque than would be comfortable by hand. Solid item and stable. The plastic tips seem a bit flimsy, but they give you an extra, so no problems for now.
customer_reviews.author: Mike C.

customer_reviews.title: Light weight but not great
customer_reviews.text: Flimsy and over complex design. The metal screws dont have a washer system and the predrilled holes are basically the screw head size. Without even over tightening the screw went past the spot it should have.
customer_reviews.author: Rachelle

customer_reviews.title: As advertised!
customer_reviews.text: This product is exactly as advertised. It was a little tricky to put together for the first hooks but then it got easier. Be sure to have a good sized Phillips head screw driver. It holds quite a few items, including coats, hats, dog leashes and purses. I really like it.
customer_reviews.author: A1Reader

customer_reviews.title: Easy assembly, sturdy, multifunctional.
customer_reviews.text: Great! I got a black one for my mom and a white one for myself and we both lover them! They are sturdy and can fit a lot of item--coats, bags, hats, etc. Also, very easy to assemble--my mom had no problem (she sometimes struggles). I live in an apartment with 5 other girls, so our living always got super messy with all of our coats and bags, but this has saved our lives! We can still keep our apartment clean while keeping some things we use a lot in our living space. So nice!
customer_reviews.author: The Kings

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a small space.
customer_reviews.text: The feet do not stick out, which is what I was afraid of. Therefore, I don't have the fear that someone is going to trip over it when they come in from the backyard. Perfect for some coats and dog leash/perfect as a second coat rack!
customer_reviews.author: Patricia J. Weinacker

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but . . .
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful coat tree. Reasonable price. Easy to put together. Very nice black shiny finish. So why do they include chrome screws which stick out like a sore thumb, instead of black screws which would blend into the finish? You will have to ask them. It really detracts from the appearance.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase
customer_reviews.text: It doesn’t look cheap for a reasonably priced item. It should be easier for a guy to assemble it but for me I had blisters on my fingers by the time I was done. Over all, happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Swimfast

customer_reviews.title: Horrible, unstable coat hanger!!
customer_reviews.text: Defective coat hanger. DO NOT BUY!! ABSOLUTE WASTE OF MONEY!! It does not assemble properly, it is only sturdy on very soft floors like carpet and can disassemble pretty quickly. Very unstable and unreliable, I would absolutely not recommend. Get something more expensive and that will last longer. I am just using it as a pole now for a shade on my balcony.
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: good product but can be difficult to get together
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one of these we bought but this one was much more difficult to put together. The first went together smoothly but not this one. The screws did not fit right would not break through the hole. Finally with help we were able to get this together.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda W

customer_reviews.title: Light, but sturdy
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! Easy to put together. Did it in about 20 minutes. We needed a new coat rack because our old wooden one broke. This one has a smaller footprint which is really nice! We are using it for winter gear and has held up so far without tipping! Very impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Northern Man Craft

customer_reviews.title: Serves the purpose
customer_reviews.text: It curiously has three legs when it could have easily had four to prevent it from tipping, but I haven't had a problem with that because of the way I have my coats hanging on it. It's of decent quality for the price and easy to put together. I think it's fine for what it is. I have no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: dreamer_rt

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: My then 14 yrs old assembled this. I bought it to hang my Christmas stockings on last Christmas, worked out beautifully. It disassembles just as easy too. Very sturdy product.
customer_reviews.author: zereka

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.text: One of the legs did not have predrilled holes like the other 2 legs. Good thing I had a drill handy. The supplied screw driver to tighten the hard to reach holes was useless. Didn't fit the screw heads. Disappointing product.
customer_reviews.author: PartlyCloudy

customer_reviews.title: unstable. be careful with kids
customer_reviews.text: i really liked that there were hooks near the bottom so thre kid's could easily hang their coats, however it needs another leg. it's very unstable
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy, cannot fully screw together!!!
customer_reviews.text: I do not recommend ordering this. It comes with the wrong hardware and is impossible to completely screw in. As a result, all of the hooks are wobbly. This was delivered an hour ago and I’ve finally given up and decided to send it back. What a disappointing piece of crap.
customer_reviews.author: Kim T.

customer_reviews.title: Great coat organizer, sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Assembly took a little more effort than I initially thought but worth the effort since the coat rack is ver stable and sturdy. Helped us to organize our coats and jackets and the kids love having their own hooks to keep they stuff seperate and I love that now their stuff stays off the floor or off the futon.
customer_reviews.author: Melvin Echols Jr

customer_reviews.title: Lots of pieces to put together but fairly simple. ...
customer_reviews.text: Lots of pieces to put together but fairly simple. It's lightweight which makes it wobbly. Make sure the weight of the jackets hung on it are dispersed evenly otherwise it might tip over. But it's to be expected at the price we paid. It gets the job done, which is all I needed it for.
customer_reviews.author: Brian J. Suminski

product_meta.title: LANGRIA Standing Entryway Coat Rack Coat Tree Hat Hanger Holder 11 Hooks Jacket Umbrella Tree Stand Base Metal (Black)
feature_bullets: CLASSICAL FINISH: a water and rust resistant black powder-coating matches most décor schemes
3-TIER HOOKS: 11 hooks divided into 3 tiers give ample amount of hanging options for your clothes
END CAP DESIGN: each hook has a protective end cap to prevent your clothes from tearing or slipping
TOP TIER: the tip of the top hooks provides a third tier, perfect for hanging caps, hats or scarves
EASY ASSEMBLY: assembly required; use a Phillips head screwdriver/flat blade to tight the screws

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars1,968 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
